intro: Nananthus rosulatus, commonly known as the roseleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
